metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1000127 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
memcached version prior to 1.4.37 contains an Integer Overflow vulnerability in items.c:item_free() that can result in data corruption and deadlocks due to items existing in hash table being reused from free list. This attack appear to be exploitable via network connectivity to the memcached service. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in 1.4.37 and later.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1000127` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

memcached - 1.4.25-2ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: memcached package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.25-2ubuntu1.4').
